caption: Figure 8: Epoch performance of CS, J-JOBCD, and VR-J-JOBCD in training UltraE on FB15k.
description: This figure shows the training performance of three different algorithms for training the UltraE model on the FB15k dataset. The algorithms compared are CS, J-JOBCD, and VR-J-JOBCD.  The figure includes three subplots: (a) Train accumulated loss shows the cumulative loss during training; (b) Test MRR shows the mean reciprocal rank on the test set; and (c) Test Hits shows the hit@1, hit@3, and hit@10 on the test set.  The plots illustrate the convergence speed and final performance of each algorithm.  VR-J-JOBCD shows faster convergence in terms of epochs and overall better results.

caption: Figure 8: Epoch performance of CS, J-JOBCD, and VR-J-JOBCD in training UltraE on FB15k.
description: This figure displays the training performance of three different methods: CS, J-JOBCD, and VR-J-JOBCD, on the FB15k dataset for the UltraE model. It contains three subfigures: (a) Train accumulated loss, (b) Test MRR, and (c) Test Hits. Each subfigure shows the performance of the three methods over epochs, illustrating the convergence of loss and improvements in MRR and Hits scores over time.

caption: Figure 8: Epoch performance of CS, J-JOBCD, and VR-J-JOBCD in training UltraE on FB15k.
description: This figure visualizes the performance of three different methods (CS, J-JOBCD, and VR-J-JOBCD) in training the UltraE model on the FB15k dataset.  The three subplots show the training loss, Mean Reciprocal Rank (MRR), and Hits@K (where K = 1, 3, and 10) over the epochs.  The results illustrate the comparative performance of the three methods across different evaluation metrics, providing insights into their effectiveness in knowledge graph embedding. J-JOBCD and VR-J-JOBCD are the methods proposed in this paper.

caption: Figure 8: Epoch performance of CS, J-JOBCD, and VR-J-JOBCD in training UltraE on FB15k.
description: This figure shows the training performance of three different methods (CS, J-JOBCD, and VR-J-JOBCD) on the FB15k dataset for the Ultrahyperbolic Knowledge Graph Embedding task. The plots illustrate the training loss, test MRR, and test Hits@1, Hits@3, and Hits@10 metrics over epochs.  This allows for a comparison of the convergence speed and ultimate performance of each method in this specific knowledge graph embedding task.
